perturbation.original_text: 8.2.2 The Monthly Fees will be paid to us at the place and in the manner we designate on or before the fifteenth (15th) day of each month and will be accompanied by our standard schedule setting forth in reasonable detail the computation of the Monthly Fees for such month.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.2.2 The Monthly Fees will be paid to us at the place and in the manner we designate on or before the fifteenth (15th) day of each month and will be accompanied by our standard schedule setting forth in reasonable detail the computation of the Monthly Fees for such month.
8.2.2.1. However, for the months of June, July and August, the monthly fees must be paid before the last day of the month to avoid late penalties. The computation schedule can be submitted the following month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the payment deadline for monthly fees. The original clause states that fees are due by the 15th of each month. The added clause creates an exception for June, July, and August, stating that payment is due by the end of the month, creating ambiguity and uncertainty about when the payments are actually due.

perturbation.original_text: 14.1.1 You fail to pay us any sums due and owing to us or the Entities under this Agreement within the cure period set forth in the notice, which shall not be less than ten (10) days;
perturbation.changed_text:
14.1.1 You fail to pay us any sums due and owing to us or the Entities under this Agreement within the cure period set forth in the notice, which shall not be less than ten (10) days; 
14.1.1.1. Notwithstanding the foregoing, failure to pay amounts under $500 within the cure period shall not be grounds for termination.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding the termination terms. Section 14.1.1 states that failure to pay any sums due results in termination, but 14.1.1.1 states failure to pay sums under $500 is not grounds for termination. This creates uncertainty as to which terms are enforcable.
